text: I am pretty sure jina is solely python. I could be mistaken, but I think the original hubl was based off of jinja as older versions of the COS/CMS were built on python, but then there was a move to java, which resulted in jinjava (aka jinja for java) which we call hubl

I have found it helpful to look at jinja documentation to understand more how hubl works (this coming from someone who has limited exposure to templating languages) even though its python and apparrently (again if I am not mistaken) hubl is java
It'd be more accurate i think to call Jinja a templating language built on java but the server itself is still a python server. I could be wrong thats just how it was explained to me
You could be right on that <@U7SL518D6>
